intro: Phthirusa nitens, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, particularly in regions with low precipitation. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
